column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.DemoNERRE|NamedentityTags
#T_RL=webanno.custom.DemoRE|NamedentityRelations|BT_webanno.custom.DemoNERRE
#Text=By using the solid-state reaction method, polycrystalline
#Text=samples of CsFe4−xSe4 were successfully synthesized.
#Text=First, FeSe precursors were prepared by reacting Fe powder
#Text=and Se powder (Alfa Aesar, 99.999% and 99.99%, respectively) at 950 K for 24 h in sealed quartz tubes.
#Text=Second, we
#Text=reground the FeSe precursors, mixed them with a stoichiometric amount of alkali metal Cs (Alfa Aesar, 99.95%) in
#Text=an alumina crucible, and sealed the crucible into an
#Text=evacuated quartz tube under vacuum.
#Text=All manipulations
#Text=were performed in a glove box filled with argon gas.
#Text=The
#Text=tube was subsequently heated up to and kept at 873 K for
#Text=24 h.
#Text=Then, the obtained sample was pulverized, pressed
#Text=into a pellet, sealed in a quartz tube under vacuum, and
#Text=heated up and kept at 923 K for 72 h.
#Text=Finally, dark-colored
#Text=samples were obtained.
#Text=The samples are sensitive to air,
#Text=and thus they are usually vacuum packed and put in the
#Text=glove box.
#Text=The synthesis process is similar to that of
#Text=previous work [18].
#Text=The only difference is that in previous
#Text=work, the quartz tube was sealed with Ar gas, while in our
#Text=experiments, the quartz tube is sealed under evacuation.
